title: Hétköznapi C1 kifejezések 1.
sentences: After five difficult exams, I can finally check off this week too.
Because of the two-hour train delay, my whole day was spent on traveling.
Először nem értettem a géprajzot, de aztán
At first I didn't understand the engineering drawing, but then the penny dropped.
Reméltem, hogy az AutoCAD nem fogja
I hoped that AutoCAD wouldn't give up the ghost in the middle of the exam.
velem, mert a legnehezebb modellt adta nekem.
The teacher picked on me/messed with me because he gave me the most difficult model.
Although I studied a lot, the asymmetrical part still got the better of me.
Fél óráig csak mértem, mire végre
I was measuring for half an hour until I finally came to a decision about the views.
My laptop sometimes gets stubborn and slows down a lot.
A nehéz vizsgahét után a hétvégén végre
After the difficult exam week, my life will finally get back on track during the weekend.
Annyira fáradt vagyok, hogy attól félek, mindjárt
I am so tired that I'm afraid I'm about to collapse / give up the ghost.
My best friend is in the loop with my studies, he always helps.
MÁV messed with the passengers again today.
volt az esze, és látta, hogy tudom a tananyagot.
Fortunately, the teacher had his head screwed on right and saw that I knew the material.
I don't want to leave the Hungarian language to its fate because of the exams.
When the idea came, the work in CAD started quickly.
Representing the threaded holes didn't get the better of me during the exam.
A mechatronika egy olyan szak, ahol mindig
Mechatronics is a major where you always have to be up to date with technology.
a legnehezebb tárgyat is az indexemben.
I finally checked off the most difficult subject in my grade book too.
During the weekend rest, my thoughts will surely get back on track.
a kulcsot, újra kell kezdenem a rajzot.
If the machine gives up the ghost, I have to start the drawing over.
le, amikor megláttam az alkatrész metszetét.
The penny only dropped when I saw the cross-section of the part.
I couldn't leave my friend to his fate at the bus stop.
The teacher sometimes grumbles about solutions that are too simple.
No matter how hard the model was, I did my best and finished it.
After the exam period, everyone recovers a bit / gets back on track.
dictionary:
Kipipál - To check off / To finish
Rámegy az ideje - To spend/waste one's time on
Leesik a tantusz - The penny drops / To suddenly understand
Beadja a kulcsot - To give up the ghost / To break down
Kiszúr valakivel - To mess with someone / To pick on
Kifog rajta - To get the better of someone
Dűlőre jut - To reach a decision / To solve
Megmakacsolja magát - To get stubborn
Helyrerázódik - To get back on track / To recover
Képben van - To be in the loop / To be informed
Sorsára hagy - To leave to its fate
Fanyalog - To grumble / To show dissatisfaction
Kitesz magáért - To do one's best / To excel
